intro: Galium sylvestre var. sudeticum, commonly known as the Sudetic wood sorrel, is a herbaceous perennial plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, trailing stems and trifoliate leaves with heart-shaped lobes. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers clustered in umbels, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its presence indicates a healthy, undisturbed ecosystem due to its specific habitat requirements.
